data.name: BitcoinEchoTest_Explain
data.value: This is a QR code for bitcoin echo testing for {0}. Read it from your phone's bitcoin wallet to perform the echo test, or donate from your computer directly to [{1}] (that's a Bitcoin Cash address). The amount (less miner fees) will be sent back to you in the next auto-payment cycle which runs every five minutes.
data.comment: The {0} is the organization name. {1} is the bitcoin address for donations.

data.name: BitcoinEchoTest_FundsReceived
data.value: Received {0} {1:N2} ({2:N0} microcoins or "bits"). They will be sent back shortly (less miner fee).
data.comment: {0} is native currency, {1} is amount in native currency

data.name: BitcoinEchoTest_FundsReceivedNative
data.value: Received {0} microcoins ("bits"). They will be sent back shortly (less miner fee).
data.comment: Used if BTC is the org native currency.

data.name: BitcoinEchoTest_Info
data.value: This is a bitcoin echo test. It tests the hotwallet. If you send a small amount here, it will be sent back to you, minus the sendback transaction fee.

data.name: BitcoinEchoTest_TxLabel
data.comment: The {0} is the organization name

data.name: CreateOrganization_ChildOfX
data.comment: "Create org as..."

data.name: CreateOrganization_Error_OrganizationNameCannotBeEmpty
data.value: Organization name cannot be empty. (You need to give the new organization a name!)

data.name: CreateOrganization_Info
data.value: You can create a new organization either as a new standalone organization, or as a child organization of the current one. (Everybody with responsibilities in a parent organization automatically has corresponding rights and privileges in all its children.)

data.name: CreateOrganization_RegularTitle
data.comment: This can be "members", etc.

data.name: CreateOrganization_Success
data.value: The new organization has been created. You have been given an non-expiring {0} in the organization, and been placed as its highest executive for the time being, so you can work with it and set it up properly. To configure the new organization, use this control panel (available later under Admin / Organization Settings).
data.comment: The {0} is membership, employment, citizenship, residence, etc.

data.name: EditOrganization_Info
data.value: WORK IN PROGRESS. Most of these options don't save yet.

data.name: EditOrganization_MemberNumberStyle
data.comment: The {0} is the membership, ambassadorship, etc.

data.name: EditOrganization_ParticipationBeginsOrg
data.comment: The {0} is member, ambassador, etc. in the gender neutral plural.

data.name: EditOrganization_ParticipationBeginsWhen
data.comment: The {0} is member, ambassador, etc. in the gender neutral plural.

data.name: EditOrganization_ParticipationChurn
data.comment: The {0} is membership, ambassadorship, etc.

data.name: EditOrganization_ParticipationCost
data.comment: The {0} is membership, etc. The {1} is the operating currency.

data.name: EditOrganization_ParticipationDuration
data.comment: The {0} is membership, ambassadorship, etc.

data.name: EditOrganization_RenewalsAffect
data.comment: (options: all organizations, one org at a time)

data.name: EditOrganization_RenewalsCost
data.comment: The {0} is the operating currency (USD etc).

data.name: OrgStaffing_Header_ExecutivePositions
data.comment: The {0} is the org name.

data.name: OrgStaffing_Header_StrategicPositions
data.comment: The {0} is the org name.

data.name: OrgStaffing_Info
data.value: Set the staffing structure for this organization, as well as its staffing at the strategic (board) and executive (C-level or equivalent) levels. You can also manage waiting volunteers and the payroll from here.

data.name: SystemSettings_Error_SmtpHostPort
data.value: SMTP Port must be numeric. Unable to parse host:port.

data.name: SystemSettings_Error_SmtpSyntax
data.value: Unable to parse user, pass, host, and/or port. (Only host is required.)

data.name: SystemSettings_Info
data.value: Various technical settings for this Swarmops installation. Not specific to any organization or person, but installation-wide.

data.name: SystemSettings_TestMailSent
data.value: Swarmops has sent you a test mail to verify your new SMTP server settings.

data.name: SystemSettings_Warning_Insecure
data.value: You really, really, REALLY should use HTTPS for a website like this. But you knew that already, didn't you?

data.name: CommenceImpersonation_Active_Header
data.comment: Visible on Dashboard

data.name: CommenceImpersonation_Active_Text
data.value: You have an active impersonation session as {0}. End impersonation.
data.comment: Visible on Dashboard. {0} is the impersonated name.

data.name: CommenceImpersonation_Confirm
data.value:
IMPERSONATE PERSON?

This is not to be taken lightly, and if you're not doing this for technical reasons, it may even be illegal depending on local laws.

The purpose of this tool is to fix technical malfunctions. Everything is logged.

Proceed?

data.name: CommenceImpersonation_Ended
data.value:
IMPERSONATION TERMINATED

Impersonation terminated at {0:HH:mm} UTC. You are acting as yourself again.
data.comment: {0} will be fed with a DateTime. The colon is rewritten automatically into the current DateTimeFormatInfo.TimeSeparator.

data.name: CommenceImpersonation_Error_Authority_Report
data.value:
IMPERSONATION DENIED

You may not impersonate somebody who is your direct manager.

data.name: CommenceImpersonation_Error_Authority_System
data.value:
IMPERSONATION DENIED

You may not impersonate somebody else with system level access.

data.name: CommenceImpersonation_Error_SelectPerson
data.value: You need to select a person to impersonate.

data.name: CommenceImpersonation_Error_Self
data.value: If you need to impersonate yourself, we suggest you log off Swarmops and seek other kind of assistance.

data.name: CommenceImpersonation_Failed
data.value:
IMPERSONATION DENIED

You do not seem to have sufficient privileges to impersonate somebody else.

data.name: CommenceImpersonation_Success
data.value:
IMPERSONATION ACTIVE

Impersonation started at {0:HH:mm} UTC. This is the Dashboard as the impersonated person sees it.
data.comment: {0} will be fed with a DateTime. The colon is rewritten automatically into the current DateTimeFormatInfo.TimeSeparator.

data.name: CommenceImpersonation_Warning
data.value:
This debugging tool allows you to impersonate another user to see and experience Swarmops as they do when logged in.

WARNING: This is a highly intrusive tool that should only be used for technical development and for requested support. Using this should not be taken lightly.

All impersonations are permanently logged, all and any actions taken while impersonated are traceable as such, and the impersonated user will be informed of the intrusion.
